level.heading: DEFINITIONS (§ 21-1099) When used in this Chapter, the following words and phrases shall have theeanings ascribed: 100 percent (100%) recyclable – capable of being collected, separated, andecovered from the solid waste stream through the District’s recyclingrograms, and either used again or reused in the manufacture or assembly ofnother package or product. Act – means the Anacostia River Clean Up and Protection Act of 2009,ffective September 23, 2009 (D.C. Law 18-55; D.C. Official Code § 8-102 eteq.). Disposable carryout bag – a bag of any material, commonly plastic or kraftaper, which is provided to a customer at the point of sale to carry purchases. Post-consumer recycled content – any material that has completed its uses a consumer item and that would otherwise have been disposed of as municipalolid waste, but that has instead been reused or reconstituted as a product oraw material. Reusable carryout bag – a bag with handles that is specifically designednd manufactured for multiple reuse and is made of cloth, fiber, otherachine-washable fabric, or durable plastic that is at least two and one-quarterillimeters (2.25 mm) thick. Source: Final Rulemaking published at 57 DCR 7208, 7215 (August 13, 2010); asmended by Errata Notice published at 59 DCR 12366 (October 26, 2012). 1
